title: Mumbai Metropolitan Region
summary: Mumbai Metropolitan Region (abbreviated to MMR and previously also as Greater Bombay Metropolitan Area),[1][2] is a metropolitan area  consisting of Mumbai (Bombay) and its satellite towns in the northern Konkan division, of the Maharashtra state in western India. The region has an area of 6,355 square kilometres (2,454 sq mi)[3] and with a population of over 26 million it is among the most populous metropolitan areas in the world.[4]
